title: All the Kremlins Men Inside Court of Vladimir Putin 2016 WWRG
description:

â€œI read this book in one night, truly a page-turner. It leaves a profoundly scary impression: [PutinÃ¢Â€â„¢s court is the] real House of Cards.â€ â€”Lev Lurie, writer and historian

All the KremlinÃ¢Â€â„¢s Men is a gripping narrative of an accidental king and a court out of control. Based on an unprecedented series of interviews with Vladimir PutinÃ¢Â€â„¢s inner circle, this book presents a radically different view of power and politics in Russia. The image of Putin as a strongman is dissolved. In its place is a weary figurehead buffetedâ€”if not controlledâ€”by the men who at once advise and deceive him.

The regional governors and bureaucratic leaders are immovable objects, far more powerful in their fiefdoms than the president himself. So are the gatekeepersâ€”those officials who guard the pathways to powerâ€”on whom Putin depends as much as they rely on him. The tenuous edifice is filled with all of the intrigue and plotting of a Medici court, as enemies of the state are invented and wars begun to justify personal gains, internal rivalries, or one factionÃ¢Â€â„¢s biased advantage.

A bestseller in Russia, All the KremlinÃ¢Â€â„¢s Men is a shocking revisionist portrait of the Putin era and a dazzling reconstruction of the machinations of courtiers running riot
